data.author: Ayn Rand
data.quote: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.

data.author: Sam Levenson
data.quote: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.

data.author: Norman Vincent Peale
data.quote: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.

data.author: Arthur Ashe
data.quote: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.

data.author: Robert H. Schuller
data.quote: Problems are not stop signs, they are guidelines.

data.author: Aristotle
data.quote: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.

data.author: Bo Jackson
data.quote: Set your goals high, and don't stop till you get there.

data.author: Harsha Bhogle
data.quote: Sometimes your greatest strength can emerge as a weakness if the context changes.

data.author: Harsha Bhogle
data.quote: Change doesn't always mean progress, but the status quo isn't always the best result either. It is merely the most convenient.

data.author: Heraclitus
data.quote: There is nothing permanent except change.

data.author: Khalil Gibran
data.quote: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.

data.author: Aesop
data.quote: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.

data.author: Napoleon Hill
data.quote: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.

data.author: Sun Tzu
data.quote: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.

data.author: George Orwell
data.quote: Happiness can exist only in acceptance.

data.author: William Blake
data.quote: Think in the morning. Act in the noon. Eat in the evening. Sleep in the night.

data.author: Steve Jobs
data.quote: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.

data.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
data.quote: Not all those who wander are lost.

data.author: George Sand
data.quote: There is only one happiness in this life, to love and be loved.

data.author: Plato
data.quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; Fools because they have to say something.
